alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Meigs; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:06AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rhea, north central Meigs and northern Bledsoe Counties through 1000 AM EDT/900 AM CDT/... At 905 AM EDT/805 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Crossville to 6 miles northeast of Spring City. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pikeville, Decatur, Spring City, Evensville, Peakland, Stinging Fork Falls State Park, Piney Falls State Park, Grandview, Melvine and Mount Crest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
